instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
Hello

I replaced a mux chip on a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>,image on external but no image on the MacBook lcd
Is it possible for mux to be bad or badly soldered and have image on external?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
Why did you change GMUX?
Any history available.
If liquid damage on video connector, that must be solved first.

BTW, isn't this machine syill in warranty?
Did you check Apple change screen program availability?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
Hello, sorry for not providing context.
It’s a liquid damaged MacBook. 
backlight shorted to mux, mux was blown and was shorting one of the power lines supplying it.
Replaced it and the machine is working. It’s a laptop I bought in November, as a repair project.
There were quite a few problems with it.
I struggled with it but I replaced the connector and the receptacle on the logic board. 

There was also corrosion on the tcon board, replaced that but I didn’t know if new tcon was working, it arrived from eBay not secured properly and slightly bent. I’m currently thinking about buying whole new lcd assembly and replacing that.
So there’s my question to be sure that I’m doing the right thing at the moment
I also replaced components around touchbar connector and touchbar connector itself.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message: You should test with known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
I agree, I was just wondering if there’s a possibility of mux chip not working but still having image on external.
I went through the schematics but I wasn’t able to understand if the mux chip is also responsible for providing image to external.
Just trying to make sure that if I spend 600-800$ on a new screen it will work

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message: Analog GMUX is only used for internal LCD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message: Oh I see, thanks man. It might be possible that I haven’t soldered the gmux properly. Is there a way to check for signals with a multimeter to see if the multiplexer is doing what it’s supposed to?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
An o-scope can help.
You can also check some signals on it.
Dificil to say something more explicit, as you didn't post your board model until now.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
I forgot, sorry.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 touchbar 16 inch MacBook Pro 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
I’m not really able to afford an oscilloscope atm, I only have a Uni-t UT61D multimeter.
I really appreciate the help, thank you

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
You need to discard the LCD assembly.
Put it apart and wait untill get similat machine, with compatible screen.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message:
I will, thank you. 
I think I’ll take a bet and buy a new screen or look for a broken one to test.
Thank you and have a great weekend

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message: Be aware about new LCD assemblies from Aliexpress; too many bulshits.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and replacing mux chip
threads.message: I’m going to purchase the assembly from MobileSentrix or other highly recommended shop.
